rComments: So worth the work. 7 problem sets, I probably spent a good 4 hours every week on each. Lecture topics each have about 120 slides. For tests, go over the lecture slides and skim readings. Really listen in lecture about what he talks about in the readings and you will do fine! I loved this class. If you put in effort, it is not that hard.

Jon Robinson is a rockstar among professors. He teaches with enthusiasm and keeps you engaged. Slides are useful and nicely summarize what he talks about& office hours are superb. Readings are INTENSE and not for the faint of heart (/mind). Tests are hard but not much of your grade. Would HIGHLY recommend if you want to learn a ton& be challenged:)

Jon is the man, he is one of the best professors I will ever have. I'm not an Econ major but his passion for the subject contagious to the point that you feel obligated to study. Tests are difficult but he curves everything at the end.  The TAs were extremely helpful as well.  If you ever get the chance to take a class with him, don't hesitate.

Absolutely the best class I've taken at UCSC. You're getting a course taught by a guy considered to be one of the top econometricians in the world. The work is tough but the class is extremely fair and his lectures go by like nothing. I've learned more from his class in a quarter than I have in my two years at UCSC. Highly recommended.

Really knows his stuff, one of the smartest people in the department. Passionate about what he teaches, the last lecture has a part on how students can get into development. Class can be somewhat difficult, but if you read the papers and the lecture slides, you should be fine. ECON 120 isn't offered that frequently, so take it if you can! GO JON!

Jon is absolutely the most amazing prof ever! He really really cares about the material he talks about, and is super helpful. Trust me, you don't need any of those EAP's to alter your world view, take Jon's class instead. Oh, and he is kinda cute too :)

This class was my favorite in my college carreer thus far. Robinson's passion for the material was contagious and I wish there were more classes similar and/or taught by him. This class made me realize that Economic Development is a career path I would like to follow when I graduate.
Don't take this class unless you like boring lectures, poor instruction, and long uninteresting articles.

HE IS A REALLY SMART PROFESSOR AND IS VERY PASSIONATE ABOUT WHAT HE TEACHES. THE CLASS IS VERY BORING AND THERE IS ALOT OF READING, BUT IF YOU WORK HARD YOU WILL MANAGE TO PASS. JUST KEEP UP WITH THE TOPICS IN LECTURE. HOMEWORKS ARE EASY IF YOU ATTEND SECTION, THEY USUALLY DO IT IN SECTION WITH YOUR TA.

One of my favorite classes at UCSC thus far. Jon is a great professor and extremely intelligent. The class was very interesting and he went over all the readings really well in class so they were less painful to get through. Overall I learned a lot and it's unfortunate that we didn't have time to cover all of the topics originally planned.

yea what is he talking about? He just goes on with lecture, neglecting the fact that people don't understand what he is talking about. His tests are ridiculous long and hard to understand. AVOID THIS CLASS NOW.

Econ 120 is the hardest class I have taken yet. Even so, I had so much fun that each lecture felt like 15 minutes. Take this class if you're genuinely interested in development and have a lot of time to study (if you're that type of person). I studied A LOT and I probably averaged a C in absolute terms, but he curves the grades at the end!

He is extremely smart and knowledgeable. I think he is an amazing resource to have at UCSC. I enjoy his lectures and talks and he is VERY helpful during office hours. I would recommend taking 113 prior to his class though it is not necessary. If you are interested in current economic development research and plan to go to grad school, TAKE HIM!!!

Very cool teacher.  Interesting class, but you can get extremely lost in lectures unless you  know how to do mathematical regression.  My advice is take econometrics before you take this course.  Tests are extremely hard, but he grades very forgivingly.  I would definitely take a course from him again because  you feel you're doing bad but aren't.
what is he talking about? He's talks as if everyone knows what's he's talking about.

Pretty interesting class, go to class, take notes, tests pretty hard but he curves everything and passes you unless you completely don't try.  Material very relatable to world today, so very interesting.  Few homeworks (challenging, but not too rough), barely any reading
